high_risk_ingredients.name: apple
high_risk_ingredients.suggestion: Prioritize apple usage in recipes; consider processing into applesauce or juice if nearing spoilage.

high_risk_ingredients.name: banana
high_risk_ingredients.suggestion: Use ripe bananas for smoothies, banana bread, or freeze for later use.

high_risk_ingredients.name: cucumber
high_risk_ingredients.suggestion: Utilize cucumbers in salads, sandwiches, or create pickled cucumbers for longer preservation.

high_risk_ingredients.name: okra
high_risk_ingredients.suggestion: Prepare okra in batches and freeze any excess for future use in stews or gumbos.

high_risk_ingredients.name: oranges
high_risk_ingredients.suggestion: Juice oranges for immediate consumption or freeze the juice for later use; zest the peels for flavoring.

high_risk_ingredients.name: patato
high_risk_ingredients.suggestion: Cook and refrigerate or freeze potatoes for later use, such as mashed potatoes or potato salads.

high_risk_ingredients.name: tomato
high_risk_ingredients.suggestion: Process tomatoes into sauce or soup for longer storage; consider canning or freezing excess tomatoes.

waste_reduction_suggestions: Implement a 'first in, first out' (FIFO) system for ingredient usage.
Monitor inventory levels daily to identify potential overstocking.
Adjust purchasing orders based on predicted consumption to avoid excess inventory.
Train staff on proper food storage techniques to extend shelf life.
Offer discounted prices on ingredients nearing their expiration date.
Donate excess ingredients to local food banks or shelters.
